Return type:

array

eyefeatures.features.complex._get_gaf(a, t, field_type, to_polar)¶
Parameters:

  • a (array) – array of shape (n_samples, n_timestamps) being angular values.

  • t (array) –

    array of shape (n_timestamps,) being timestamps for all samples in ‘a’ or (n_samples, n_timestamps) being timestamps of corresponding angular values in ‘a’,

    i.e. a[i, :] are expected to be the angles at time t[i, :].

Return type:

array

eyefeatures.features.complex._rescale(a)¶

Linearly map array to [-1, 1].

Return type:

array

eyefeatures.features.complex._shrink_matrix(mat, height, width, strategy='normal')¶

Shrinks matrix to be close to output_size x output_size. :type mat: array :param mat: 2d matrix (image channel). :type height: int :param height: height of shrunk matrix. :type width: int :param width: width of shrunk matrix. :rtype: array

Parameters:

strategy (Literal['max', 'mean', 'normal']) – strategy to use while shrinking. * ‘mean’ - 2d convolution with uniform kernel. * ‘normal’ - 2d convolution with Gauss kernel. * ‘max’ - max pooling, resulting image is the closest possible to provided ‘size’.

eyefeatures.features.complex.calculate_topological_features(scanpath, time_series, max_radius=1.0, max_time=1.0, max_dim=2, time_steps=100)¶

Calculate topological features (persistence curve and persistence entropy) for a scanpath.

Parameters:

  • scanpath (ndarray) – scanpath data array of shape (n, 2)

  • time_series (ndarray) – 1d array of time series data (e.g. x or y coordinates over time)

  • max_radius (float) – maximum radius for Vietoris-Rips filtration

  • max_time (float) – maximum threshold for the persistence curve

  • max_dim (int) – maximum dimension for persistent homology

  • time_steps (int) – number of time steps for evaluating the persistence curve and entropy

Returns:

values of persistence curve at each time step, Values of persistence entropy at each time step

eyefeatures.features.complex.get_gaf(data, x, y, t=None, field_type='difference', to_polar='cosine', flatten=False)¶

Calculates Gramian Angular Field for (x,y) coordinates.

Parameters:

  • data (DataFrame) – dataframe containing fixation coordinates.

  • x (str) – x-coordinate column name.

  • y (str) – y-coordinate column name.

  • t (Optional[str]) – timestamps column name.

  • field_type (Literal['difference', 'sum']) – which type of field to calculate. If “difference”, then GADF is returned, otherwise (“sum”) GASF is returned.

  • to_polar (Literal['regular', 'cosine']) – conversion from cartesian to polar coordinates. * ‘regular’: standard conversion calculating arctan(y/x). * ‘cosine’: angle is calculated as cosine of series data, radius is taken as timestamps.

  • flatten (bool) – bool, whether to flatten the array.

Return type:

array

Returns:

tensor of shape (2, n_coords, n_coords), where n_coords is the length of input dataframe.

eyefeatures.features.complex.get_heatmap(x, y, shape, check=True)¶

Get heatmap from scanpath (given coordinates are scaled and sorted in time) using Gaussian KDE. :type x: ndarray[Any, dtype[TypeVar(ScalarType, bound= generic, covariant=True)]] :param x: x coordinates of scanpath. :type y: ndarray[Any, dtype[TypeVar(ScalarType, bound= generic, covariant=True)]] :param y: y coordinates of scanpath. :type shape: Tuple[int, int] :param shape: if tuple with single integer, then square matrix is returned, otherwise k must be (height, width)

tuple and rectangular matrix is returned.

Parameters:

check (bool) – whether to check ‘shape’ for correct typing.

Returns:

heatmap matrix.

eyefeatures.features.complex.get_heatmaps(data, x, y, shape, pk=None)¶

Convenience wrapper for get_heatmap function.

eyefeatures.features.complex.get_hilbert_curve(data, x, y, scale=True, p=4)¶

Map scanpath to points on 1D Hilbert curve.

Parameters:

  • data (DataFrame) – dataframe containing fixation coordinates.

  • x (str) – x-coordinate column name.

  • y (str) – y-coordinate column name.

  • scale (bool) – whether to scale the scanpath to [0, 1] before mapping to Hilbert curve. If false, then

  • p (int) – order of Hilbert curve, unit square is divided into (2^p)x(2^p) smaller squares. Higher value of p indicates better locality preservation.

Return type:

array

Returns:

scanpath mapping to 1D Hilbert curve.

eyefeatures.features.complex.get_hilbert_curve_enc(data, x, y, scale=True, p=4)¶

Map scanpath to values on Hilbert curve and encode to single feature vector.

Parameters:

  • data (DataFrame) – dataframe containing fixation coordinates.

  • x (str) – x-coordinate column name.

  • y (str) – y-coordinate column name.

  • scale (bool) – whether to scale the scanpath to [0, 1] before mapping to Hilbert curve. If false, then

  • p (int) – order of Hilbert curve, unit square is divided into (2^p)x(2^p) smaller squares. Higher value of p indicates better locality preservation.

Return type:

array

Returns:

scanpath encoding in 2^p-dimensional feature space using 1D Hilbert curve.

eyefeatures.features.complex.get_mtf(data, x, y, n_bins=10, output_size=1.0, shrink_strategy='normal', flatten=False)¶

Calculates Markov Transition Field for (x,y) coordinates. :type data: DataFrame :param data: dataframe containing fixation coordinates. :type x: str :param x: x-coordinate column name. :type y: str :param y: y-coordinate column name. :type n_bins: int :param n_bins: number of bins to discretize time series into. :type output_size: Union[int, float] :param output_size: fraction between 0 and 1. Specifies fraction of input series length to shrink output to. :type shrink_strategy: Literal['max', 'mean', 'normal'] :param shrink_strategy: strategy to use for convolution while shrinking. Ignored if ‘output_size’ is equal to

size of ‘data’.

Parameters:

flatten (bool) – bool, whether to flatten the array.

Return type:

array

Returns:

tensor of shape (2, n_coords, n_coords), where n_coords is the length of input dataframe.

eyefeatures.features.complex.get_rqa(data, x, y, metric, rho)¶

Calculates recurrence quantification analysis matrix based on given fixations. :type data: DataFrame :param data: dataframe containing fixations :type x: str :param x: column name of x-coordinate :type y: str :param y: column name of y-coordinate :type metric: Callable :param metric: callable metric on R^2 points :type rho: float :param rho: threshold radius

Return type:

ndarray

Returns:

rqa matrix

eyefeatures.features.complex.hilbert_huang_transform(data, max_imf=1)¶

Perform Hilbert-Huang transform on a given data sequence.

Parameters:

  • data (ndarray) – input sequence of form (x, y) coordinates

  • max_imf (int) – maximum number of intrinsic mode functions to extract

Return type:

ndarray

Returns:

np.ndarray: intrinsic mode functions from an input data vector

eyefeatures.features.complex.lower_star_filtration(time_series, max_dim=1)¶

Compute the Lower Star filtration for a time series.

Parameters:

  • time_series (ndarray) – time series data

  • max_dim (int) – maximum dimension for persistent homology

  • persistence – persistence diagram.

eyefeatures.features.complex.pca(matrix, p, cum_sum=None)¶

PCA compression.

Parameters:

  • matrix (ndarray[Any, dtype[TypeVar(ScalarType, bound= generic, covariant=True)]]) – matrix to get principal components from (n x m)

  • p (int) – number of first principal components to leave

  • cum_sum (Optional[float]) – instead of p, leave such number of principal components, that 0.0 <= a_cum_sum <= 1.0 fraction of information is conserved.

Returns:

matrix of eigenvectors (m x m), projection (n x p), rows means (n x 1)

eyefeatures.features.complex.persistence_curve(persistence_diagram, t)¶

Compute the persistence curve for a persistence diagram at time t.

Parameters:

  • persistence_diagram (List[Union[Tuple, ndarray]]) – persistence diagram [(birth, death), …]

  • t (float) – threshold time for persistence curve

Returns:

sum of persistence intervals active at time t

eyefeatures.features.complex.persistence_entropy_curve(persistence_diagram, t)¶

Compute the persistence entropy curve for a persistence diagram at time t.

Parameters:

  • persistence_diagram (List[Union[Tuple, ndarray]]) – persistence diagram [(birth, death), …]

  • t (float) – threshold time for persistence entropy curve

Returns:

entropy value at time t

eyefeatures.features.complex.vietoris_rips_filtration(scanpath, max_dim=2, max_radius=1.0)¶

Compute the Vietoris-Rips filtration for a point cloud.

Parameters:

  • point_cloud – scanpath data as a numpy array of shape (n, 2)

  • max_dim (int) – maximum dimension for persistent homology

  • max_radius (float) – maximum radius for the filtration

Returns:

persistence diagram and simplex tree

eyefeatures.features.complex.xy2h(x, y, p)¶

Mapping of 2D space to 1D using Hilbert curve.

Parameters:

  • x (int) – x-coordinate of a point, 0 <= x < 2^p.

  • y (int) – y-coordinate of a point, 0 <= y < 2^p.

  • p (int) – order of Hilbert curve, unit square is divided into (2^p)x(2^p) smaller squares. Higher value of p indicates better locality preservation.

Return type:

int

Returns:

corresponding point on 1D Hilbert curve.

Algorithm: https://people.math.sc.edu/Burkardt/py_src/hilbert_curve/hilbert_curve.py.

class eyefeatures.features.measures.HurstExponent(n_iters=10, fill_strategy='last', var=None, pk=None, eps=1e-22, return_df=True)¶

Bases: MeasureTransformer

__init__(n_iters=10, fill_strategy='last', var=None, pk=None, eps=1e-22, return_df=True)¶

Approximates Hurst Exponent using R/S analysis.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hurst_exponent

Parameters:

  • n_iters – number of iterations to complete. Note: data must be of length more than 2 ^ n_iters.

  • fill_strategy (Literal['mean', 'reduce', 'last']) – how to make vector be length of power of 2. If “reduce”, then all values after 2 ^ k-th are removed, where n < 2 ^ (k + 1). Other strategies specify the value to fill the vector with up to the closest power of 2, “mean” being the mean of vector, “last” being the last value of vector (makes time-series constant at the end).

  • var (Optional[str]) – column name of sequence points.

  • pk (Optional[List[str]]) – list of column names used to split pd.DataFrame.

  • eps (float) – division epsilon.

  • return_df (bool) – Return pd.Dataframe object else np.ndarray.

_abc_impl = <_abc._abc_data object>¶
_check_init(X_len)¶
_make_pow2(x)¶
Return type:

array

class eyefeatures.features.measures.SaccadeUnlikelihood(mu_p=1.0, sigma_p1=0.5, sigma_p2=1.0, mu_r=1.0, sigma_r1=0.3, sigma_r2=0.7, psi=0.9, x=None, y=None, aoi=None, pk=None, return_df=True)¶

Bases: MeasureTransformer

Calculates cumulative negative log-likelihood of all the saccades in a scanpath with respect to the saccade transition model. Default distribution parameters are derived from Potsdam Sentence Corpus.

Parameters:

  • mu_p (float) – mean of the progression distribution

  • sigma_p1 (float) – left standard deviation of the progression distribution

  • sigma_p2 (float) – right standard deviation of the progression distribution

  • mu_r (float) – mean of the regression distribution

  • sigma_r1 (float) – left standard deviation of the regression distribution

  • sigma_r2 (float) – right standard deviation of the regression distribution

  • psi (float) – probability of performing a progressive saccade

Returns:

the cumulative Negative Log-Likelihood (NLL) of the saccades

__init__(mu_p=1.0, sigma_p1=0.5, sigma_p2=1.0, mu_r=1.0, sigma_r1=0.3, sigma_r2=0.7, psi=0.9, x=None, y=None, aoi=None, pk=None, return_df=True)¶
_abc_impl = <_abc._abc_data object>¶
_sklearn_auto_wrap_output_keys = {'transform'}¶
calculate_features(X)¶
Return type:

List[float]

calculate_saccade_proba(s)¶
Parameters:

s (float) – saccade length

Return type:

float

Returns:

The probability of the saccade length s.

static nassym(s, mu, sigma1, sigma2)¶

Calculates assymetric Gaussian PDF at point s.

Parameters:

  • s (float) – saccade length

  • mu (float) – mean of the distribution

  • sigma1 (float) – standard deviation for the left part of the distribution (s < mu)

  • sigma2 (float) – standard deviation for the right part of the distribution (s >= mu)

Return type:

float

Returns:

probability density value for the given saccade length s

eyefeatures.features.scanpath_complex.get_cross_product_matrix(D, weight_vector=None)¶

Calculates cross-product matrix.

Estimates expected path by a given method

Parameters:

  • data (DataFrame) – pd.Dataframe containing coordinates of fixations and its timestamps

  • x (str) – Column name of x-coordinate

  • y (str) – Column name of y-coordinate

  • path_pk (List[str]) – List of column names of groups to calculate expected path (must be a subset of pk)

  • pk (List[str]) – List of column names used to split pd.Dataframe

  • method (str) – method to calculate expected path (“mean” or “fwp”)

  • duration (Optional[str]) – Column name of fixations duration if needed

  • return_df (bool) – Return pd.Dataframe object else np.ndarray

Return type:

Dict[str, Union[DataFrame, ndarray]]

Returns:

Dict of groups and Union[pd.Dataframe, np.ndarray] of form (x_est, y_est) or (x_est, y_est, duration_est)

eyefeatures.features.stats module¶

class eyefeatures.features.stats.FixationFeatures(**kwargs)¶

Bases: StatsTransformer

__init__(**kwargs)¶

Base class for statistical features. Aggregate function strings must be compatible with pandas.

_calc_feats(X, features, transition_mask)¶

Method calculates features passed to constructor, i.e. keys of self.features_stats. In case of SaccadeFeatures, it returns dictionary {‘length’: np.array, ‘velocity’: np.array, …}. transition_mask is boolean mask of the same shape as X, i-th value is False if X’s i-th value is first fixation in block. Block is defined as sequential fixations in same AOI, maximum by inclusion (which means that block cannot contain another block). Thus, each AOI is split in blocks and first fixation in each block is then removed.

Return type:

List[Tuple[str, Series]]

_check_params()¶

Method checks that all requested features could be calculated with provided data.

property _fp: str¶

Feature prefix to use in feature names.

_sklearn_auto_wrap_output_keys = {'transform'}¶
class eyefeatures.features.stats.MicroSaccades(min_dispersion, max_speed, **kwargs)¶

Bases: StatsTransformer

__init__(min_dispersion, max_speed, **kwargs)¶
Parameters:

rule – specify list of quadrants direction to which classifies

regressions, 1st quadrant being upper-right square of plane and counting anti-clockwise.

_calc_feats(X, features, transition_mask)¶

Method calculates features passed to constructor, i.e. keys of self.features_stats. In case of SaccadeFeatures, it returns dictionary {‘length’: np.array, ‘velocity’: np.array, …}. transition_mask is boolean mask of the same shape as X, i-th value is False if X’s i-th value is first fixation in block. Block is defined as sequential fixations in same AOI, maximum by inclusion (which means that block cannot contain another block). Thus, each AOI is split in blocks and first fixation in each block is then removed.

Return type:

List[Tuple[str, Series]]

_check_params()¶

Method checks that all requested features could be calculated with provided data.

property _fp: str¶

Feature prefix to use in feature names.

_sklearn_auto_wrap_output_keys = {'transform'}¶
class eyefeatures.features.stats.RegressionFeatures(rule, deviation=None, **kwargs)¶

Bases: StatsTransformer

__init__(rule, deviation=None, **kwargs)¶
Parameters:

  • rule (Tuple[int, ...]) – must be either 1) tuple of quadrants direction to classify regressions, 1st quadrant being upper-right square of plane and counting anti-clockwise or 2) tuple of angles in degrees (0 <= angle <= 360).

  • deviation (Union[int, Tuple[int, ...], None]) – if None, then rule is interpreted as quadrants. Otherwise, rule is interpreted as angles. If integer, then is a +-deviation for all angles. If tuple of integers, then must be of the same length as rule, each value being a corresponding deviation for each angle. Angle = 0 is positive x-axis direction, rotating anti-clockwise.

_calc_feats(X, features, transition_mask)¶

Method calculates features passed to constructor, i.e. keys of self.features_stats. In case of SaccadeFeatures, it returns dictionary {‘length’: np.array, ‘velocity’: np.array, …}. transition_mask is boolean mask of the same shape as X, i-th value is False if X’s i-th value is first fixation in block. Block is defined as sequential fixations in same AOI, maximum by inclusion (which means that block cannot contain another block). Thus, each AOI is split in blocks and first fixation in each block is then removed.

Return type:

List[Tuple[str, Series]]

_check_params()¶

Method checks that all requested features could be calculated with provided data.

property _fp: str¶

Feature prefix to use in feature names.

_sklearn_auto_wrap_output_keys = {'transform'}¶

abstract _calc_feats(X, features, transition_mask)¶

Method calculates features passed to constructor, i.e. keys of self.features_stats. In case of SaccadeFeatures, it returns dictionary {‘length’: np.array, ‘velocity’: np.array, …}. transition_mask is boolean mask of the same shape as X, i-th value is False if X’s i-th value is first fixation in block. Block is defined as sequential fixations in same AOI, maximum by inclusion (which means that block cannot contain another block). Thus, each AOI is split in blocks and first fixation in each block is then removed.
